SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

net.sourceforge.gjtapi.raw.remote
Interface RemoteProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
RemoteProviderImpl, RemoteProviderImpl_Stub
public interface RemoteProvider
extends java.rmi.Remote

This is a remote version of the Generic JTAPI Service Provider.

createCall

public SerializableCallId createCall(SerializableCallId id,
                                     java.lang.String address,
                                     java.lang.String term,
                                     java.lang.String dest)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                     javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException,
                                     javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException,
                                     javax.telephony.InvalidPartyException,
                                     javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException,
                                     RawStateException,
                                     javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException
Make a call. Not that this follows the JTAPI sematics of an idle call being created synchronusly (two connections). Events from the raw provider will indicate state transitions.
Parameters:
id - The callId reserved for the call.
address - The logical address to make a call from
term - The physical address for the call, if applicable
dest - The destination address
Returns:
A call Id. This may be used later to track call progress.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - A distribution (network) error has occured.

getCallsOnAddress

public CallData[] getCallsOnAddress(java.lang.String number)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Ask the raw TelephonyProvider to give a snapshot of all Calls on an Address.

This will only be called on a TelephonyProvider that "trottle"s call events.

Note: This implies that the given Call will have events delivered on it until such time as a "TelephonyProvider::releaseCallId(CallId)". Creation date: (2000-06-20 15:22:50)

Parameters:
number - The Address's logical number
Returns:
A set of call data.

getCallsOnTerminal

public CallData[] getCallsOnTerminal(java.lang.String name)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Ask the raw TelephonyProvider to give a snapshot of all Calls at a Terminal.

This will only be called on a TelephonyProvider that "trottle"s call events.

Note: This implies that the given Calls will have events delivered on it until such time as a "TelephonyProvider::releaseCallId(CallId)". Creation date: (2000-06-20 15:22:50)

Parameters:
name - The Terminal's logical name
Returns:
A set of call data.

getCapabilities

public java.util.Properties getCapabilities()
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Ask the raw provider to update the capabilities offered by the provider This is expected to return a map of capability names to strings. If the string starts with 't' or 'T', the capability is turned on, otherwise it is turned off. If the value is not found for a key, the default value is used.

To use this feature, the RawProvider needs to copy the GenericCapabilities.props file and change any properties that are supported differently. The the RawProvider could load the properties file into a Properties object and return it. If the default value is supported, then the corresponding line may be omitted from the file. Note that the generic layer may choose to ignore certain settings if they are not supported at that layer. Creation date: (2000-03-14 14:48:36)

Returns:
java.util.Map

getPrivateData

public java.io.Serializable getPrivateData(CallId call,
                                           java.lang.String address,
                                           java.lang.String terminal)
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                           java.io.NotSerializableException
Get the PrivateData from a raw TelephonyProviderInterface Object. This applies to the previous action on the Object.

This method is mapped to any of six logical raw TPI provider objects based on the following mapping, where the three columns represent the three method parameters:
Call Address Terminal
Provider
Call X
Address X
Terminal X
Connection X X
TerminalConnection X X X
"blank" indicates void
Creation date: (2000-08-05 22:25:45)

Parameters:
call - A CallId or void
address - An Address name or void
terminal - A Terminal name or void
Returns:
Any serializable object. IF PrivateDataCapabilities.canGetPrivateData() returns false, this will return null.
Throws:
java.io.NotSerializableException - If the returned object is not serializable.

getTerminals

public TermData[] getTerminals()
                        throws javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException,
                               java.rmi.RemoteException
Get a list of available terminals. This may be null if the Telephony (raw) Provider does not support Terminals. If the Terminal set it too large, this will throw a ResourceUnavailableException

Since we went to lazy connecting between Addresses and Terminals, this is called so we don't have to follow all Address->Terminal associations to get the full set of Terminals. Creation date: (2000-02-11 12:29:00)

Returns:
An array of terminal names, media type containers.
Throws:
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - if the set it too large to be returned dynamically.

Parameters:
address - The address number we want terminal names for.
Returns:

Throws:
javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException - indicating that the address is unknown.

join

public CallId join(SerializableCallId call1,
                   SerializableCallId call2,
                   java.lang.String address,
                   java.lang.String terminal)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   RawStateException,
                   javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException,
                   javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException,
                   javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException,
                   javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Join one call to another call (Connection) For assisted transfer, this allows the joining of an on-hold call to an active call. Unassisted transfer and single-step transfer can be accomplished in the JTAPI layer by combining this call with a release() method call.
Parameters:
call1 - One call
call - Another call
address - The address of a TerminalConnection to be used as a ConferenceController
terminal - The terminal of a TerminalConnection to be used as a ConferenceController
Returns:
The new call. This may be the same as one of the original calls.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - A distribution (network) error has occured.

play

public void play(java.lang.String terminal,
                 java.lang.String[] streamIds,
                 int offset,
                 RTCHolder[] rtcs,
                 java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
          throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException
Start playing a set of audio streams named by the streamIds (may be urls).
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to play the audio on.
streamIds - The ids for the audi streams to play, usually URLs
int - offset The number of milliseconds into the audio to start
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune the playing.
optArgs - A dictionary of control arguments.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a PlayerEvent that describes what went wrong.

record

public void record(java.lang.String terminal,
                   java.lang.String streamId,
                   RTCHolder[] rtcs,
                   java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
            throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
Start recording an audio streams named by the streamId (may be urls).
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal to record the audio from.
streamId - The id for the audio streams to create, usually a URL
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune the recording.
optArgs - A dictionary of control arguments.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a RecorderEvent that describes what went wrong.

releaseCallId

public void releaseCallId(SerializableCallId id)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Tell the provider that it may release a call id for future use. This is necessary to ensure that provider call ids are not released until the JTAPI layer is notified of the death of the call. Creation date: (2000-02-17 22:25:48)
Parameters:
id - The CallId that may be freed.

reportCallsOnAddress

public void reportCallsOnAddress(java.lang.String address,
                                 boolean flag)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                 javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException,
                                 javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Tell the RawProvider that Calls which reach this Address should have Call, Connection and TerminalConnections events reported on them. Creation date: (2000-03-07 15:17:16)
Parameters:
address - The name of the address to change the reporting status on.
flag - true if reporting is to be enabled, false to stop events relating to the call.
Throws:
javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException - If the address is not known by the telephony provider.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - If the provider could not find the reources to report the calls.

reportCallsOnTerminal

                                  boolean flag)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                  javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException,
                                  javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Tell the RawProvider that Calls which reach this Terminal should have Call, Connection and TerminalConnections events reported on them. Creation date: (2000-03-07 15:17:16)
Parameters:
address - The name of the terminal to change the reporting status on.
flag - true if reporting is to be enabled, false to stop events relating to the call.
Returns:
true if the terminal is known, false otherwise
Throws:
javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException - If the terminal is not known by the telephony provider.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - If the reporting could not be started due to resource constraints.

The CallId created by the provider.

retrieveSignals

public RawSigDetectEvent retrieveSignals(java.lang.String terminal,
                                         int num,
                                         SymbolHolder[] patterns,
                                         RTCHolder[] rtcs,
                                         java.util.Dictionary optArgs)
                                  throws javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException
Receive DTMF tones from a terminal
Parameters:
terminal - The terminal the signal receiver is attached to.
num - The number of signals to retrieve
syms - A set of symbols patterns to return
rtcs - A set of runtime control sets that tune the signalling.
optArgs - A dictionary of control arguments.
Returns:
A RawSigDetectEvent factory for creating an event that can be sent getSignalBuffer() to retrieve the signals.
Throws:
javax.telephony.media.MediaResourceException - A wrapper for a SignalDetectorEvent that describes what went wrong.

Call Address Terminal

Address X
Terminal X
Connection X X
TerminalConnection X X X

Creation date: (2000-08-05 22:25:45) return Any serializable object. If the object's Capabilities.canSendPrivateData() returns false, this returns null.
